events.originalText: Citizens of the United Kingdom voted in favour of leaving the European Union.
events.subtitle: 2016 United Kingdom European Union membership referendum
events.headline: UK Votes to Leave EU

events.originalText: Under the terms of UN Security Council Resolution 2118, the last of Syria's declared chemical weapons were shipped out for destruction.
events.subtitle: United Nations Security Council Resolution 2118
events.headline: Syria's Chemical Weapons Destroyed

events.originalText: Croatian War of Independence: The Battle of the Miljevci Plateau ended after a failed counterattack by forces of the Republic of Serbian Krajina against the Croatian Army who had captured the plateau.
events.subtitle: Croatian War of Independence
events.headline: Croatian War of Independence: Battle Ends

events.originalText: The first installment of the video-game series Sonic the Hedgehog was released.
events.subtitle: Sonic the Hedgehog (1991 video game)
events.headline: First Sonic the Hedgehog Game Released

events.originalText: A bomb attributed to the Sikh separatist group Babbar Khalsa destroyed Air India Flight 182 above the Atlantic Ocean, killing all 329 on board.
events.subtitle: Khalistan movement
events.headline: Air India Flight 182 Destroyed by Bomb

events.originalText: Chinese American Vincent Chin died after being beaten into a coma in Highland Park, Michigan, U.S., by two automotive workers who were angry about the success of Japanese auto companies.
events.subtitle: Killing of Vincent Chin
events.headline: Vincent Chin Dies After Beating

events.originalText: The Los Angeles Dodgers started Steve Garvey, Davey Lopes, Ron Cey, and Bill Russell in the infield, beginning a record eight-year run in Major League Baseball for four people designated as starters for those positions.
events.subtitle: Los Angeles Dodgers
events.headline: Los Angeles Dodgers Start Record Infield

events.originalText: President Richard Nixon signed Title IX (co-author Patsy Mink pictured) into law as part of the Education Amendments, prohibiting gender discrimination in any educational program receiving U.S. federal funds.
events.subtitle: Richard Nixon
events.headline: President Nixon Signs Title IX into Law

events.originalText: In a nationwide referendum, Gamal Abdel Nasser (pictured) was elected President of Egypt, a post he held until his death in 1970.
events.subtitle: 1956 Egyptian referendum
events.headline: Gamal Abdel Nasser Elected President of Egypt

events.originalText: Canada's largest recorded onshore earthquake struck Vancouver Island, British Columbia.
events.subtitle: 1946 Vancouver Island earthquake
events.headline: Canada's Largest Onshore Earthquake Hits Vancouver Island

events.originalText: After a closely supervised visit by the Red Cross to Theresienstadt Ghetto in German-occupied Czechoslovakia, Maurice Rossel reported that conditions there were "almost normal".
events.subtitle: Theresienstadt Ghetto and the Red Cross
events.headline: Red Cross Reports Conditions in Theresienstadt Ghetto

events.originalText: The College Board administered the first SAT, a major standardized test for university and college admissions in the United States.
events.subtitle: College Board
events.headline: First SAT Test Administered by College Board

events.originalText: Led by French historian Pierre de Coubertin, an international congress at the Sorbonne in Paris formed the International Olympic Committee to revive the ancient Olympic Games.
events.subtitle: Pierre de Coubertin
events.headline: International Olympic Committee Formed to Revive Games

events.originalText: The Parliament of Canada passed the Rocky Mountains Park Act, creating Banff National Park in Alberta as the country's first national park.
events.subtitle: Parliament of Canada
events.headline: Banff National Park Created in Alberta

events.originalText: Stand Watie became the last Confederate general of the American Civil War to surrender to Union forces.
events.subtitle: Stand Watie
events.headline: Last Confederate General Surrenders

events.originalText: War of the First Coalition: Napoleon signed the Armistice of Bologna, agreeing a ceasefire between France and the Papal States.
events.subtitle: War of the First Coalition
events.headline: Napoleon Signs Armistice of Bologna

events.originalText: Anglo-Spanish War: During the Action of Faial, an English attempt to capture a Portuguese carrack, reputedly one of the richest ever to set sail from the Indies, caused it to explode with all the treasure lost.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Spanish War (1585–1604)
events.headline: English Attempt to Capture Portuguese Carrack Ends in Explosion

events.originalText: Reconquista: Troops of the Emirate of Granada defeated those of the Kingdom of Castile and the Kingdom of León in the Battle of Moclín.
events.subtitle: Reconquista
events.headline: Emirate of Granada Defeats Kingdom of Castile and Kingdom of León

events.originalText: War of Saint Sabas: In an action off Trapani, Sicily, a Venetian fleet captured all 27 opposing Genoese vessels.
events.subtitle: War of Saint Sabas
events.headline: Venetian Fleet Captures Genoese Vessels in Battle off Trapani
